title: Young chef, 23, left covered in blood after being slashed in the face by thugs 'for being gay'
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A YOUNG man who was left covered in blood after being attacked for being gay has spoken out of the horrific bashing. 
Lee Michaels, 23, said he was followed through the streets of Manchester by two men, with the pair sniggering and calling him a “fag” before hitting him with a sharp object. Lee Michaels Lee Michaels was left covered in blood after being targeted in the hate crime Lee Michaels 7 Lee said the men had been following him through the streets of Manchester before attacking him 
The chef said he was now terrified of another attack after having been left on the ground with several gashes on his face. 
He told The Sun Online: “I realised near the turn off at Portland Street that I was being followed so I stopped outside a club and they asked me if I had a fag. 
“I said no and they started sniggering, and one said ‘there’s a big one right there’.” Lee Michaels The young man needed several lots of stitches to repair the gash on the side of his face after the attack Lee Michaels 7 His clothes were covered in blood, with witnesses rushing to help 
Shocked Lee, who had been walking to through the city after meeting up with his friend, then tried to walk away but said one of the men then swung at him. 
He said: “I thought at first he was trying to grab a cigarette but he hit me in the face. 
“I didn’t feel any pain at first, I didn’t even realise I had been hit.” 
He said that people nearby quickly rushed to help him as he fell to the ground, with the drama unfolding just after midnight on Monday January 6. 
He said that while the attack happened extremely quickly, he believed he had been cut with a sharp object, potentially glass. Lee said: “It took a good five minutes to realise that I was covered in blood. 
“I didn’t realise how bad it was.” 
Police and ambulance crews were called to the scene, taking him straight to hospital – with the culprits running off into the night. 
Lee underwent a number of procedures, with doctors stitching up the huge gashes on his face. 
Lee described his attackers as “cowards”, saying he thought they had just been trying to find “trouble”. Lee Michaels Lee said the attack had shaken his confidence, with police recording the attack as a hate crime Lee Michaels Police are now investigating the attack that left Lee nursing serious gashes to his face Lee Michaels Lee Michaels said he had never been targeted in a hate crime before 
He said he was struggling to walk through the streets with his badly injured face. 
Lee said: “I’m quite a nervous person anyway, but even thinking about it now is too much. 
One of the men has been described as of African descent, tall and wearing a hoodie. 
The second man, who was also of African descent, was bald. 
Greater Manchester Police have been contacted for comment.
